title: Building Enterprise RAG Systems with Foundry IQ
description:
**Foundry IQ**
Join us Tuesday, February 10th, as we explore Foundry IQ and how it enables the next generation of AI agents with enterprise-ready Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG).

**Schedule**
5:45 PM ‚Äî Doors open
6:00 PM ‚Äî Food, drinks, and networking
6:30 PM ‚Äî Presentation begins

**About This Session**
In this session, we are going to explore Foundry IQ, the next generation of Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) that provides AI agents with a unified knowledge layer enriched with enterprise context. Built on Azure AI Search, Foundry IQ simplifies agent development by connecting multiple knowledge sources through a single API, offering automatic indexing, advanced AI-driven retrieval, and enterprise-grade security with fine-grained access control.

**Speaker**
Talles Valiatti is a Microsoft MVP, Solution Architect, and .NET developer with experience in cloud solution architecture. He frequently speaks at events in both Brazil and the US about these technologies and is passionate about innovation and the tech community.

**Location**
Marathon Consulting (2nd Floor)
Plenty of free parking is available behind the building. If you're arriving later, the doors may be locked‚Äîcheck the sign on the door for instructions on how to get in.

**Details**
Food and drinks will be provided. This event is free and open to all skill levels.

title: üßú‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è The AI Collective Hampton Roads | Securing AI in 2026
description:
**From Intelligence to Authority: Securing AI in 2026**

*Why AI makes security architecture more important, not less.*

This is a **live, digital-only event** focused on how AI is reshaping cybersecurity, identity, and enterprise architecture. No in-person attendance. Join from anywhere.

As AI systems become embedded into security workflows, identity systems, and automation pipelines, the real risk isn‚Äôt that AI might be wrong. The real risk is giving a probabilistic system authority in places that require certainty.

This session reframes AI security from ‚Äúmodel safety‚Äù to **architecture safety**.

We‚Äôll explore how trust, identity, governance, and control planes must evolve as intelligence becomes non-deterministic.

If you work in cybersecurity, cloud, or engineering, this is how you stay ahead of the threat landscape going into 2026.

Join Andrew Stafford for a practical, architect-level breakdown of what secure AI systems must look like at enterprise scale.

**üîç What You‚Äôll Learn**

**Why AI changes the fundamentals of security architecture**
How probabilistic systems break assumptions behind IAM, RBAC, and traditional controls.

**The real AI threat model for 2026**
Prompt injection, over-permissioned agents, shadow AI, and why these are architectural failures, not model failures.

**Why AI must never sit in the authority path**
The critical boundary between planning, policy, and execution.

**The control plane vs data plane model for AI security**
Where AI belongs, where it must never go, and how this separation prevents catastrophic failure.

**Plan ‚Üí Verify ‚Üí Execute: the secure AI pattern**
How AI proposes, security decides, and systems act.

**AI agents as identities**
Why agents must be treated like PAM workloads with strict scoping, short-lived credentials, and approval paths.

**Guardrails that actually work**
Where enforcement must happen:

* Before retrieval
* Before execution
* Before data leaves your system

**What ‚Äúexplainability‚Äù really means in enterprise security**
Not how the model thinks, but why the system acted.

**How secure systems should fail**
Loss of intelligence is acceptable. Loss of control is not.
You‚Äôll leave with a new mental model for designing AI systems that are **controllable, auditable, and defensible**.

**üéôÔ∏è Your speaker**

**Andrew Stafford**
Co-Lead of The AI Collective Hampton Roads
25+ years across cybersecurity, cloud, and AI architecture including work with Amazon, NASA, healthcare platforms, and enterprise security systems.
Specializes in designing AI systems that remain secure, explainable, and governable at scale.

**Who should attend?**

* Cybersecurity professionals
* Cloud & platform engineers
* Identity & IAM architects
* Security leaders and CISOs
* AI engineers building production systems
* Anyone responsible for deploying AI in regulated or high-trust environments

**Why this matters**

We‚Äôre entering an era where intelligence is cheap and uncertainty is embedded into systems.
Security can no longer assume:

* Deterministic logic
* Predictable behavior
* Clear trust boundaries

AI forces us to move from **trusting intelligence** to **controlling authority**.
This talk shows how to build AI systems that can:

* Be paused
* Be explained
* Be audited
* Be contained

Because in 2026, the most valuable AI systems won‚Äôt be the smartest.
They‚Äôll be the ones that remain safe when something goes wrong.

**Organizers & Partners**

**Organizers**
[The AI Collective Hampton Roads](https://linktr.ee/aicollectivehr)

**Platinum partner**
[TechArk Solutions](https://gotechark.com/)
[Regent University](https://www.regent.edu/)

**Silver partner**
[Assembly Norfolk](https://www.assemblynfk.com/)
[TEKsystems](https://www.teksystems.com/en/)

**Space partner**
757 Collab

\- \- \-

**Our parent org**
[The AI Collective](https://www.aicollective.com/) is a global non-profit community uniting 100,000+ pioneers ‚Äì founders, researchers, operators, and investors ‚Äì exploring the frontier of AI in major tech hubs worldwide. Through events, workshops, and community-led research, we empower the AI ecosystem to collaboratively steer AI‚Äôs future toward trust, openness, and human flourishing

*All attendees and organizers at events affiliated with The AI Collective are subject to our* ***[Code of Conduct](https://www.aicollective.com/files/Code%20of%20Conduct.pdf)****\*\*.*

title: Kalyan Inturi-Designing a Central Identity DB Unifying Authentication
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!!**
As SaaS platforms grow through acquisitions, identity data often becomes fragmented across multiple databases and user stores, leading to inconsistent access controls, operational complexity, and security risk. This session presents a real-world case study of consolidating authentication and authorization into a centralized, SQL Server‚Äìbacked identity platform used across multiple products.

The solution combined OpenID Connect and OAuth 2.0 with a central identity database, token-time claim enrichment, and event-driven replication to maintain data consistency while supporting near-zero-downtime migrations. The talk focuses on how SQL Server was used to model users, roles, and permissions; support reliable change propagation; and enable auditing, deprovisioning, and session management at scale.

Attendees will learn practical lessons around schema design, transactional consistency, asynchronous replication, and operational monitoring for identity data. The techniques discussed apply broadly to any system where correctness, availability, and security depend on a well-designed and highly reliable SQL Server data layer.
group: Hampton Roads SQL Server User Group

title: üßú‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏èAI Collective-HR | AI ideation, research, and validation
description:
## **Using AI to Think Like a Successful Entrepreneur**

*An AI-powered ideation, research, and validation workshop*

Building ideas is easy. Proving they matter is hard.

This hands-on workshop is designed to help you use AI as a thinking partner to move faster from vague ideas to clearer, validated directions. Instead of guessing or relying on gut instinct alone, you will learn practical ways to use AI to challenge assumptions, explore markets, and pressure-test ideas before you invest too much time or energy.
This session focuses on how founders, builders, and teams can use AI to think more clearly, ask better questions, and make more informed decisions. No hype. No pitch decks. Just practical frameworks you can apply right away.

**üîç What you‚Äôll learn**

* How to use AI to generate and refine early-stage ideas
* Turning assumptions into research questions instead of guesses
* Exploring customer and market perspectives with AI support
* Simple validation techniques you can use immediately
* How to move from intuition-driven thinking to evidence-informed decisions

This is not about memorizing prompts or chasing tools. It is about learning how to think better with AI in the loop.

**üß† Your facilitators**
**[Andrew Stafford](https://www.linkedin.com/in/theandrewstafford/)** is a Fractional Chief AI Officer and Director of Technology and Global Alliances at The AI Collective. He works with executive teams to establish clear ownership of AI decisions, focus on real ROI, and avoid unnecessary risk, tool sprawl, and hype-driven strategy.

**[Ted Patterson](https://www.linkedin.com/in/tedjpatterson/)** is a Product and GTM Engineer at Reelist and a founding leader of The AI Collective Hampton Roads. With nearly 20 years of experience across product, research, design, and systems, he focuses on turning complex ideas into testable hypotheses, clear narratives, and practical next steps.

Together, Andrew and Ted will guide you through an end-to-end ideation, research, and validation flow that blends strategic thinking with hands-on experimentation.

**üë• Who should attend?**

* Founders and early-stage startup teams
* Product managers, designers, and engineers
* No-code and automation builders
* Researchers and analysts
* Students and career switchers exploring entrepreneurship
* Anyone curious about using AI to think more clearly about ideas and markets

No prior AI experience required.

**‚ö° Why this matters**
AI is changing how ideas are formed, tested, and funded. The real advantage is not knowing more tools. It is knowing how to ask better questions, challenge assumptions earlier, and validate faster.
This session is about building that muscle.

**‚ÑπÔ∏è FAQs**
**Is there free parking?**
Yes. There is plenty of free parking available on the ECPI University campus.

**Is this event free?**
Yes. Space is limited, so please RSVP and cancel if your plans change.

**Will food or drinks be provided?**
Light snacks and drinks will be available.

Through events, workshops, and community-led research, we empower the AI ecosystem to collaboratively steer AI‚Äôs future toward trust, openness, and human flourishing.

title: Cybersecurity - Chesapeake Weekend Afternoon Networking (WAN)
description:
**Attention Information Security and Cybersecurity Professionals!**
Are you looking to meet new people who share your interests? Whether you're thinking about entering cybersecurity, have recently entered the field, or are a seasoned professional, we welcome all to join us for an evening of networking, learning, and fun.
**Why Attend?**
Enjoy a night out at the cozy and welcoming **Neat Bird** in Chesapeake, where you can connect with like-minded individuals. We love bringing people together to share insights and build lasting connections. Join us for some beers‚Äîor not, if that's your preference. Our goal is to help you forge meaningful relationships in the cybersecurity community.
**About ISSA-HR**
The Information Systems Security Association of Hampton Roads (ISSA-HR) hosts social events throughout the region, providing a space for cybersecurity professionals and enthusiasts to get together, share stories, learn new information, and meet new people. With years of cybersecurity expertise, ISSA-HR is committed to promoting the industry and nurturing the next generation of cybersecurity professionals.

**RSVP now and bring a friend!** We look forward to seeing you there!

**Location:** Neat Bird, 565 Belaire Ave, Chesapeake, VA 23320
Time: **6:00 - 8:00 PM**
group: Information Systems Security Association ISSA Hampton Roads

description:

As always, HUGE thanks to Assembly for hosting.‚Ä®Learn more about the amenities and community of Assembly at [https://www.assemblynfk.com/](https://www.assemblynfk.com/)

Street parking is free after 6 pm. From 6:30-7:00 pm, we will have someone at the door to let you in. After 7, message the #javascript channel on 757Dev Slack. We meet in the Fur Room on the 4th floor.

title: üßú‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è The AI Collective Hampton Roads | Connections & (grocery) carts
description:
**Meet people and pick up your weekly groceries.**

**ü§ù A casual networking hangout in the grocery store cafe**
‚ÄãChats, connections, & grocery carts is a relaxed, social-first networking event for curious, friendly people across Hampton Roads who enjoy good conversation and knocking out life errands at the same time.

This is not a lecture.
This is not a pitch night.
And you definitely do not need to ‚Äúprepare‚Äù anything.

It is simply a low-pressure space to meet new people, have real conversations, and casually connect while wandering the aisles and picking up your weekly groceries.

Whether you are deeply into AI and automation, adjacent to tech and creativity, or just someone who enjoys thoughtful conversations with interesting humans, you belong here.

**‚ú® What to expect**

* ‚ÄãCasual, open networking with a mix of builders, creatives, technologists, founders, students, and professionals
* ‚ÄãEasy, organic conversations while shopping at your own pace
* ‚ÄãLight, optional conversation prompts to help break the ice if you want them
* ‚ÄãNo presentations, no panels, no pressure to ‚Äúnetwork correctly‚Äù
* ‚ÄãA friendly, welcoming environment for all backgrounds and experience levels
* ‚ÄãCome as you are. Grab a cart or a basket. Pick up dinner for the week. Meet a few new people along the way.

**‚Äãüë• Who should attend**
‚ÄãChats, connections, & grocery carts is for:

* ‚ÄãPeople who enjoy meeting others without forced networking vibes
* Builders, creatives, technologists, and curious minds
* AI, automation, no-code, and tech-adjacent folks
* Students and career switchers exploring what is next
* Founders, consultants, operators, and professionals
* Anyone who likes good conversation and low-stakes socializing
* ‚ÄãIf you enjoy thoughtful chats and meeting people in unexpected places, you will fit right in.

**üè™ Why a grocery store**

* ‚ÄãYou were probably going to the store anyway.
* ‚ÄãHosting this event in a grocery store keeps things human, practical, and approachable. It removes the pressure of traditional networking and turns it into something simple, efficient, and a little fun.
* ‚ÄãTwo errands. One cart.

**üí° Why this event exists**
‚ÄãCommunity grows best in relaxed, everyday spaces.

Chats, Connections, & Grocery Carts exists to create an easy, human-centered way for people to connect without titles, talks, or expectations. It is about building relationships, sharing ideas naturally, and strengthening the local community one conversation at a time.

Come say hi. Leave with groceries. Make a few new connections along the way.

**‚ÑπÔ∏è Other bits of info & FAQs**

* This is a free community event
* Drinks or food are available for purchase depending on the venue
* Photos or videos may be taken for community and marketing purposes
* Come solo or bring a friend
* ‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãIs there free parking in the area? Yes. If you can‚Äôt snag a spot in their parking lot, feel free to park somewhere close by along a side street. There‚Äôs usually lots of space.
* ‚Äã‚Äã‚ÄãIs this free?
Yes, but space is limited. Make sure to RSVP

title: Hampton Roads DevFest 2026
description:
Mark your calendar for Hampton Roads DevFest 2026! This unique gathering will once again spotlight local speakers, showcasing our community's deep and diverse talent.

Hampton Roads DevFest is more than a conference; it's a tribute to our dynamic local developer community. It's an ideal platform to highlight the exceptional places to work in the Hampton Roads area, emphasizing innovative technological strides. This event caters to everyone in the tech sphere, from seasoned developers and industry veterans to emerging talents and students.

Organized by RevolutionVA, a dedicated 501(c)(3) non-profit, our mission is to advance software development education throughout Virginia. Our passion for promoting learning and growth in technology is at the heart of DevFest.

Take advantage of this unparalleled opportunity to network, learn from top industry professionals, and celebrate the remarkable achievements of our tech community. Whether you're looking to sharpen your skills, explore new career pathways, or simply immerse yourself in a community of like-minded tech enthusiasts, Hampton Roads DevFest is your destination.

Join us as we recognize and nurture the extraordinary tech talent that thrives in Hampton Roads. Let's connect, discover, and grow together at Hampton Roads DevFest 2026!

title: Free OPEN Passes to DeveloperWeek 2026
description:
The Williamsburg Software Developers Group is serving as a Community Partner to [DeveloperWeek 2026](https://www.developerweek.com/). Our logo is posted on the [Community Partners](https://www.developerweek.com/community/partners/) web page. Our members are eligible for free OPEN passes to the conference.

The in-person conference in San Jose, CA is February 18-20. The virtual conference, [DeveloperWeek Global](https://www.developerweek.com/global/), is March 4. The [website ](https://www.developerweek.com/global/)and schedule for the virtual conference are still under development. Note that times on the web site are listed in Pacific time, so add three hours for our time.

Register now to get your free OPEN Pass ($195 value). You must register at the link below (and not just indicate that you are attending here on Meetup):

https://link.devnetwork.com/XZ23isaA

title: 10 Years A Kotlin Dev
description:
Kotlin has emerged as a compelling choice for both Android and backend development, offering a modern language with strong null-safety, concise syntax, and excellent interoperability with Java. In this meetup, we'll explore the key advantages that drive teams to adopt Kotlin‚Äîfrom improved developer productivity and safer Android apps to structured concurrency with coroutines on the backend. We'll highlight how Kotlin aligns with today's Android ecosystem, integrates with popular backend frameworks, and enables cleaner, more maintainable code across platforms. At the same time, adopting Kotlin is not without challenges. We'll take an honest look at the tradeoffs, including learning curve considerations, build performance, interoperability friction with legacy Java code, and operational concerns in backend systems. Through a retrospective lens, this talk will share practical lessons learned and guidance on when Kotlin is the right choice‚Äîand when it may not be‚Äîhelping attendees make informed decisions for their Android and server-side projects.

This is a Hybrid event, you can also attend virtually using this link: TBA

description:
Information Security and Cybersecurity professionals, come out and meet some new people. Have a night out on the town. Meet new people with similar interests. We love connecting with people who have similar interests. Whether you thinking about entering cybersecurity, recently entered, or seasoned, we welcome all to come out and drink some beers with us, or not drink with us. We want to meet you, to meet new people. We had enough of the virtual world with covid. Lets get back out and start meeting people again.

The Information Systems Security Association of Hampton Roads (ISSA-HR) is setting up social events throughout Hampton Roads to give Cyber Security Professionals and those interested in the subject a place to: Get Together, Share Stories, Learn Information, Meet New People.
IÔªøSSA-HR has years of Cyber Security knowledge that we are happy to give. Our organization is here to promote Cyber Security and bring up the next generation of Cyber Security Professionals.

Location: **The Casual Pint**: 3380 Princess Anne Rd, Ste 111, Virginia Beach, VA 23456
Time: **6:00 - 8:00 PM**
group: Information Systems Security Association ISSA Hampton Roads

title: Cybersecurity - Chesapeake Weekend Afternoon Networking (WAN)
description:
**Attention Information Security and Cybersecurity Professionals!**
Are you looking to meet new people who share your interests? Whether you're thinking about entering cybersecurity, have recently entered the field, or are a seasoned professional, we welcome all to join us for an evening of networking, learning, and fun.
**Why Attend?**
Enjoy a night out at the cozy and welcoming **Neat Bird** in Chesapeake, where you can connect with like-minded individuals. We love bringing people together to share insights and build lasting connections. Join us for some beers‚Äîor not, if that's your preference. Our goal is to help you forge meaningful relationships in the cybersecurity community.
**About ISSA-HR**
The Information Systems Security Association of Hampton Roads (ISSA-HR) hosts social events throughout the region, providing a space for cybersecurity professionals and enthusiasts to get together, share stories, learn new information, and meet new people. With years of cybersecurity expertise, ISSA-HR is committed to promoting the industry and nurturing the next generation of cybersecurity professionals.

**RSVP now and bring a friend!** We look forward to seeing you there!

**Location:** Neat Bird, 565 Belaire Ave, Chesapeake, VA 23320
Time: **6:00 - 8:00 PM**
group: Information Systems Security Association ISSA Hampton Roads

title: Norfolk Cybersecurity Networking & Happy Hour
description:
From 6-9pm for a night of networking and fun at The OV Beach Tavern located in Ocean View, Norfolk. Happy hour is till 8pm with fantastic deals, check the 2nd image for details.

Connect with fellow tech enthusiasts, Information Security, and Cybersecurity professionals in a relaxed atmosphere. Share ideas, make new friends, and enjoy delicious drinks and snacks. Don't miss out on this opportunity to expand your professional circle and have a great time!

Free tickets and further details are available at:
https://www.eventbrite.com/e/1980179496178
group: Information Systems Security Association ISSA Hampton Roads

title: John Sterrett- Advanced Data Protection Strategies with Azure SQL
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!! (PLEASE NOTE DATE CHANGE FOR THIS MEETING ONLY)**
Organizations handle increasing amounts of growth with their sensitive data. Data engineers must protect their data from external attackers, application users, and even privileged employees like database administrators.

This session will teach you how to protect your data while maintaining functionality and performance. You will leave this session knowing how and why column-level encryption, row-level security, and auditing are keys to securing your data.
group: Hampton Roads SQL Server User Group

title: Kevin Feasel- Data Virtualization in SQL Server
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!!**
SQL Server's data virtualization stack has evolved throughout the past decade, allowing you to integrate SQL Server with a variety of external systems, such as Oracle, MongoDB, Cosmos DB, Azure Blob Storage, and AWS S3. In this talk, we will briefly cover the history of data virtualization in SQL Server and focus on how we can write T-SQL queries to access data from heterogeneous sources, both in SQL Server 2025 and in prior versions. Finally, we will look at several interesting use cases for data virtualization in the modern data environment.
group: Hampton Roads SQL Server User Group

title: Joey D'antoni- SQL Server 2025 Deep Dive: Essential Innovations for DBAs & Devs
description:
**IN PERSON MEETING!!!!!**
SQL Server 2025 is the AI database for enterprises. But there are more new things than just AI‚Äîin this demo filled, full-day workshop, you will learn about:

‚Ä¢ Engine improvements that make everything just run faster
‚Ä¢ How SQL Server 2025 helps you operate more securely
‚Ä¢ Further enhancements to high availability
‚Ä¢ Building event-driven architectures with change event streaming

Master the benefits of the latest release of SQL Server and how to deploy it in your organization.
group: Hampton Roads SQL Server User Group
